articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes opened higher on Friday after a keenly awaited report showed the unemployment rate rose in August and wage growth slowed, spurring expectations that the Federal Reserve could pause its interest rate hikes.
articles.title: Wall St opens higher after data point to softening labor market

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Disney (DIS.N) and Charter Communications (CHTR.O) traded salvos over their unresolved distribution agreement after channels like ESPN went dark on Thursday for customers of Charter's Spectrum cable service.
articles.title: Disney, Charter rates dispute spills over to TVs as ESPN, ABC go dark

articles.author: Ismail Shakil, David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canada unveiled draft rules on Friday for a law to compel internet giants to pay news outlets, saying it was addressing the tech companies' concerns, but Facebook said it would stick to plans to block news in the country.
articles.title: Canada tries to address news law concerns, Facebook not convinced

articles.author: Amina Niasse
articles.description: Black Americans were the only U.S. racial or ethnic group to see a drop in their jobless rate in August, helping drive the gap between the rates for Black people and white people back to near a record low.
articles.title: Jobless rate for Black Americans drops as others rise

articles.author: Rory Carroll
articles.description: Inter Miami have changed their plans and will no longer stay this weekend at a Santa Monica hotel where workers recently went on strike, a union source told Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Inter Miami decide not to stay at LA hotel where workers are striking

articles.author: Lucy Raitano, Danilo Masoni
articles.description: Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) unseated LVMH (LVMH.PA) as Europe's most valuable listed company on Friday, ending the French luxury group's 2-1/2 year-long reign at the top.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk briefly overtakes LVMH as Europe's most valuable company

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A federal judge on Friday authorized the payout of $41.53 million to investors who lost money when Elon Musk tweeted about taking his electric car company Tesla (TSLA.O) private.
articles.title: U.S. Judge approves payouts from Elon Musk's SEC settlement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three of China's biggest banks on Friday cut interest rates on a range of deposits in an effort to ease pressure on their shrinking margins as lenders move to lower mortgage rates to prop up a struggling property sector and a faltering economy.
articles.title: Major Chinese banks cut deposits rates, paving the way for mortgage rate cuts

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukraine said on Friday its troops had broken through Russia's first line of defences in several places, though they have then encountered even more heavily-fortified Russian positions.
articles.title: Ukraine says troops breach Russian lines, heavier defences lie ahead

articles.author: Brendan O'Brien
articles.description: An Ohio police department on Friday released body camera footage showing an officer fatally shooting a pregnant Black woman in the parking lot of a grocery store two weeks ago after she refused to exit her car and instead bumped him with her vehicle.
articles.title: Ohio police release video of fatal shooting of pregnant Black woman
